title: Rassie Erasmus insists South Africa no longer haunted by 'Miracle of Brighton' as they seek Japan revenge
text:
South Africa head coach Rassie Erasmus insists his side are no longer haunted by the “Miracle of Brighton” ahead of their quarter-final clash against hosts Japan.

The Springboks were beaten 34-32 by Japan on the English south coast in the pool stages of the last World Cup. Since then South Africa have beaten Jamie Joseph’s side 41-7 in Kumagaya in a World Cup warm-up match, which was a deliberate attempt to erase the ghosts of 2015.

“In all honesty, the reason for that Japanese warm-up was to erase the Brighton game so if we played them in the play-offs that match would hopefully not get mentioned against us,” Erasmus said. “It is 1-1 now and we have a quarter-final against a really tough team....
description: South Africa head coach Rassie Erasmus insists his side are no longer haunted by the “Miracle of Brighton” ahead of their quarter-final clash against hosts Japan.
